title: Replace your Microsoft 365 subscription with a cheaper lifetime license
content:
Macworld

When you think about it, Microsoft 365 costs you more every single month. You’re never done paying for it, so as long as you rely on apps like Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, you’re always losing money. The alternative is to switch to a lifetime license that might be a little more expensive on day one, but it’s cheaper every month after. 

Microsoft Office Home and Business for Mac comes with 

  • Word
  • Excel
  • PowerPoint
  • Outlook
  • Teams (basic)
  • OneNote (free version) 

You can install each of these apps on one computer one time, and you’ll never pay a subscription fee or recurring costs of any kind. They work great, too. Microsoft 365 may have some new AI updates, but AI tools are everywhere. Do you really need one popping up and distracting you when you’re just trying to write something? 

Time to replace Microsoft 366. 

Through March 30 at 11:59 p.m. PT, you can get a Microsoft Office Home and Business Lifetime License for $79.97 (reg. $219).
